greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 2*prime(n) - prime(n+1).
comment: It is known that a(n) > 0 for all n (Tchebycheff, 1850).
The analog for Ramanujan primes is Paksoy's theorem that 2*R(n) - R(n+1) > 0 for n > 1. See A233822. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Dec 16 2013
reference: J. V. Uspensky and M. A. Heaslet, Elementary Number Theory, McGraw-Hill, NY, 1939.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
program: (PARI) { for (n=1, 1000, write("b062234.txt", n, " ", 2*prime(n) - prime(n + 1)) ) } # _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 03 2009
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 29 2001
